Headline: Loop 'L' Service Delayed at Adams/Wabash
ShortDescription: Loop 'L' trains are standing at Adams/Wabash due to fire department activity. Crews working to restore service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Loop 'L'  trains are standing at Adams/Wabash due to an fire department activity. 

As a result of the delayed train, Green Line trains will be rerouted to the outer Loop (trains will board and exit on the Brown Line platforms at Washington/Wells, Quincy/Wells, LaSalle/Van Buren, State/Van Buren, Adams/Wabash, Washington/Wabash, State/Lake and Clark/Lake.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines. These may include these shuttle buses:

  • Brown Line shuttle buses will operate from Merchandise Mart to Clark/Lake
  • Orange Line shuttle buses will operate from Halsted to Harold Washington Library-State/Van Buren
  • Pink Line shuttle buses will operate from Polk to Ashland/Lake

Personnel are working to restore service. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Service Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, then Racine (Blue Line) Stations, Only
ShortDescription: Pink Line trains operate from 54th to Polk only, then connect w/Blue Line at Racine for continuing service, due to fire department activity at Adams/Wabash.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Pink Line trains operate from 54th to Polk only, then connect w/Blue Line at Racine for continuing service, due to fire department activity at Adams/Wabash.

As a result, Pink Line trains are running as follows:

  • Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, and then are diverted to Racine on the Blue Line for direct connections at Racine to continuing Blue Line train service to/from downtown.

Using connecting Blue Line service:

  • For service to downtown from Pink Line stations between 54th/Cermak and Polk, take a Pink Line train toward the Loop and stay on board until the train reaches Racine on the Blue Line. Transfer to an O'Hare-bound Blue Line train from the same platform for service into downtown.

  • For service from downtown to Pink Line stations between Polk and 54th/Cermak, take a Blue Line train toward Forest Park to Racine. Stay on the same platform side and wait for a 54th/Cermak-bound Pink Line train.

 Shuttle buses are also available between Polk and Ashland to provide connections to continuing Green Line service.

Other possible alternatives may include: 

  • #9 Ashland
  • #21 Cermak
  • #49 Western
  • #50 Damen
  • #52 Kedzie/California
  • #53 Pulaski
  • #54 Cicero
  • #60 Blue Island-26th
  • #82 Kimball-Homan
  • #94 South California
  • #157 Streeterville-Taylor buses

...including to/from and in combination with other 'L' services.

Note that if you take a bus to/from the Pink Line, you may also be able to connect to/from the Blue Line's Forest Park branch or Green Line along Lake Street directly via that bus route.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.
